data.title: The Dining Diamond of Muncie!
data.text: Vera Mae's is a must for a foodie stopping, visiting or driving through Muncie! This quirky restaurant has some of the best food in town, along with wonderful ambiance and service. Be sure to try the french onion soup - serviced with scissors because it's just THAT good! Great cocktail selection and live jazz a few nights a week! If the menu prices scare you, try out lunch instead of dinner. Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Nice atmosphere
data.text: I've been to Vera Mae's twice now and we'll probably go back. It offers a nice atmosphere and nice change of pace compared to the other restaurants in town.  We have only been here for dinner so I cannot comment on the lunch.  The service is good and the timing is great....we had a very nice family night.  I will say that I'm just a little disappointed in the food though.   Both times we have been here the meal is a little over cooked and dry.  Two of my family of four ordered different chicken dishes and they thought the chicken was a little over done.  I had a pasta dish with shrimp and the shrimp was over done as well.   Last time we were here I had a filet and it was a little dry as well.   I will say that the seasoning and flavor is great, and is what will have me coming back to try it again.   The artichoke dip is great and one of my favorites, it was not as hot as last time but still very good.

owner_response.author: KentShuff, Owner at Vera Mae's Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I am so sorry for our shortcomings. The servers are instructed to come to me immediately if there is a situation. Was the server aware? We never want a customer to leave without being very satisfied. Please accept my sincere apology. Best regard, Kent
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Don't waste your money!
data.text: This was supposed to be a fine dining establishment, the only thing that suggested it was fine dining were the prices. If I'm going to pay an exorbitant amount of money for food, I expect that food to be worth the amount of money I spend. IT WAS NOT! Our "fancy" dinner started out with 1 measly little roll each, then our salads were literally just leaves on a plate with a cup of dressing. The only other time I have seen unprepared salads are are buffets. Then we got our entree. I know with higher end restaurants, you don't get to choose your sides unless they are served family style. However, if you don't have a chef that is competent enough to choose the correct sides to go with that dish, get yourself a new chef. We ordered a filet of beef that came with a weird spicy rice, and gross looking brussel sprouts. To top it off, the longer we were there, the louder it got. Apparently this place is the hot spot for business men to come get super drunk after work. It was so loud I couldn't even talk to my husband. The whole experience was so disappointing.

data.title: Best place to eat in Muncie
data.text: Vera Mae's is a most enduring part  of and central to Muncie's downtown now. The exterior is restrained but relatively upscale from its surroundings. Outside seating along Walnut Street is available during good weather. Inside, an eclectic interior awaits with a rich variety of paintings, art objects, furniture of various sorts and styles, in two adjoining dining rooms, one of which features a grand piano and bar. The bartender makes a great martini and had excellent single malt Scotch recommendations. The wine list considerately offers a nice mixture wines over a significant price range. From the antipasto through dessert, we were treated to thoughtfully prepared and presented delights.

data.title: Don't miss this one!!
data.text: What a delightful evening we had at Vera Mae's!! We were greeted warmly and shown to the table outside we had reserved. Our waiter, Tyler, was exceptionally attentive and friendly. My husband asked him his name again when we couldn't remember it from his first introduction. At that point he asked us our names and called us by name the rest of the evening! Very special touch to a most special experience! My husband was thrilled with the extensive and upscale bar offerings. He had a delicious raspberry chicken Brie dish. I had amazing rack of lamb. Servings were very generous. We finished the evening with scrumptious house-made pecan pie. Sitting outside on a beautiful summer evening was so very pleasant. Don't miss Vera Mae's!!

data.title: Best in Muncie
data.text: Without question, the finest restaurant we've been to in Muncie.  Wait staff was a little slow, but the food was great.  Started with a crab cake appetizer.  Two big cakes filled with crab and a little spicy bite to it.  Next, the salmon in papillote.  Served with polenta and mixed veggies, it was quite good.  Started with a French onion soup that was served with a pair of scissors (to cut the long strands of cheese).  Never saw that before.  Music supplied by a gentleman on piano.  Add a nice bottle of wine and you're in for a nice evening.  Dinners will run about $25-30 plus wine.  Not "cheap" but worth it.   Would definitely go back whenever I'm back in Muncie.

data.title: Abhorrent service for group dining
data.text:
We chose Vera Mae's to have a nice dinner for our 10 year reunion. We booked the wine cellar room weeks in advance and were assured they could handle dinner for a group of our size (about 25).

We arrived on time at 7:30. The server assigned to our side of the room took more than a half hour to take our drink orders, and then another half hour to order dinner.

The front two tables apparently received decent service, receiving their drinks, appetizers, salads, bread, and dinner in a timely manner. The back two tables, however, did not receive their entrees until after the front tables were completely finished eating. They never received bread at all, and their dinners came so late that the staff was pushing them to rush through their food because the restaurant was closing at 10 (2.5 hours after the group arrived).

Additionally, the food took so long that the kitchen ran out of both the starch and vegetable of the day. This is understandable- it happens when restaurants are busy, but the server did not notify the "late" eating tables of the change, and surprised several people with food they could not eat due to dietary restrictions.

The server also failed to be attentive and on the one occasion he bothered to refill water glasses for the neglected back tables, he seemingly intentionally skipped over people with obviously empty glasses.

Had we been at a diner, family restaurant, or other casual venue, none of this would have been as upsetting. However, given the price ($30/entree) and atmosphere of the restaurant,  we were incredibly disappointed with our evening.

Maybe the restaurant is enjoyable if  you come as a couple or a group of four. But the restaurant should not advertise its ability to accommodate large groups if it cannot follow through with adequate service.

owner_response.author: KentShuff, Owner at Vera Mae's Bistro, responded to this review
owner_response.text: It's best to apologize for our perceived shortcomings and carry on.  There would be very little benefit in explaining the entire situation and how the content of this review is both vastly exaggerated and perhaps contains a touch of non-truth. Our review have always been very positive and we pride ourselves in offering lovely food by a professional wait staff; so when a review comes along like this, I take it very seriously. I contacted the person who was in charge of this event since I had not heard a word about substandard service. I felt much better after our conversation. She had an entirely different take on the event and was actually quite surprised to hear of the above review. But the fact is that the reviewer was not happy with their experience and for that.......we are sorry.  :(
owner_response.title: Owner Response
